options.text: excess <math><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">N</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></math>  and  <math><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">S</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></math> from burning fossil fuels
excess production of <math><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">N</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub></math> by industry and coal gas
excess release of carbon monoxide by incomplete combustion
excess formation of <math><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></math> by combustion and animal respiration

solution.text: Air pollution is the increase in the concentration of substances which become toxic and hazardous to the atmosphere. Industrial waste gases and burning of fossil fuels release  <math><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">N</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></math>  and  <math><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">S</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></math>  which gather in the atmosphere. During lightning, these gases form nitric acid and sulphuric acid and come down mixed with rain. Such rain is termed acid rain. Acid rains are known to cause harm to flora, fauna and infrastructures.
